author: Aditi R
text:
To ensure that all flood-affected people get their due subsistence allowance, the Tamil Nadu Slum Clearance Board has been organising camps to educate them on the same.

“We have held over 20 camps in the two housing tenements where our volunteers have explained to them the process of opening savings accounts so that they get the allowance,” said a senior official from TNSCB.

Of the 4,059 people resettled in the last three months in Okkiyam, Thoraipakkam and Perumbakkam, 734 have opened their accounts with Canara and IDBI banks. oO them, 514 have already received the allowance money.

Officials say volunteers are going door-to-door at these tenements, asking residents to visit the nearest bank to open accounts.

Flood-affected people can receive Rs. 2,500 for 12 months. The board began the process on January 28 after completing the resettlement. “To avail of the fund, residents need to have accounts, and produce their allotment papers and ID proof. Even if they don’t have the proof, we will help them.”
title: Camps help flood-hit open bank accounts
